title: New award launched for 2017 CIPD North East of England HR&D Awards
text:
New award launched for 2017 CIPD North East of England HR&D Awards The Excellence in Resourcing and Talent Management award recognises firms who attract, retain and reward their staff Share Left to right, the team at Sullivan Brown Resourcing Partners: Jo-anne Cain, Melanie Bolton, Maureen Brown, Claire Randerson-Smith and Melanie Irving Share Get business updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Appointing the best people to drive business forward is key to the region’s success – so attracting staff and keeping them is vital. 
That’s why a brand new awards is being introduced for the 2017 CIPD North East of England HR&D Awards. 
The Excellence in Resourcing and Talent Management award, sponsored by Sullivan Brown Resourcing Partners, aims to recognise organisations that have used effective and innovative strategies to attract, retain and reward talent – and the judging panel are waiting to hear from North East businesses about the tactics they use to bring in and then attain their talented staff. 
Elouise Leonard-Cross, Co-Chair of the CIPD North East of England branch said: “This new category recognises the range of activity in attracting, identifying rewarding and retaining talent within organisations. 
“Having the right talent within an organisation is key to success however the match of talent to roles, along with retaining skills and knowledge is an ongoing challenge for many organisations. 
“According to CIPD Outlook the resourcing and talent outlook for organisations is looking generally positive with the number of vacancies in the UK economy remaining well above historical average levels and short-term employment outlook remaining strong. 
“However the impact of Brexit has created concerns in certain sectors around ability to resource, particularly retail, accommodation and food services. 
“Increases in market rates coupled with recruitment and retention issues are the primary factors identified by organisations as driving an upward pressure on pay. 
“A shift in reward has been seen however with an increase to 67% of employers reporting that they made a pay award in the 12 months to December 2016.” Read More Prizes on offer at CIPD Awards for firms keeping staff fit and healthy 
The sponsors for this award are Sullivan Brown Resourcing Partners, specialists in HR recruitment, in-house recruitment consultancy and outsourced independent new starter and exit interviews. 
From offices in Ponteland and Manchester, Sullivan Brown offer a personal, values driven HR recruitment service and also work with clients to help them improve direct hiring and retention capability – and they say well-structured strategies are vital for businesses to boost their chances of bringing in key employees. 
Maureen Brown, owner and managing director, said: “We’re really delighted to be sponsoring the Award for Excellence in Resourcing and Talent Management this year. 
“Our services are aimed at improving the whole candidate to colleague life cycle, and we love working with clients who recognise the importance of linking recruitment and development to attract and retain key talent. 
“As the competition for key talent increases, a well-defined Employer Value Proposition and Strategy for Talent Development will improve your chances of attracting and retaining the right people. Read More Meet the Judges for the CIPD North East of England HR&D Awards 2017 
The most successful companies are those proactively linking their recruitment message with career development opportunities. 
“We’re looking forward to seeing the different approaches being taken to ensure organisations have the best capability and agility to meet their objectives.” 
Melanie Bolton, associate director, added: “As our MI-Say exit interview service has grown, the results are showing how important career progression is, and how crucial it is to have clear, fair career paths that are accessible, realistic, but also aspirational. 
“HR, Recruitment and Retention is all about people, and effective leaders know that you need to attract, motivate, develop and retain the best people to deliver the best results.” ENTRY INFORMATION: 
The 2017 CIPD North East of England HR&D Awards are in their 11th year and are open to all types of organisations, regardless of size or sector. The winners will be announced on June 22, 2017, at an awards dinner at the Newcastle Marriott Hotel, Gosforth Park. The categories are: 
Excellence in Resourcing & Talent Management 
HR&D Excellence in SMEs 
Excellence in Organisational Development
